name: St. Sava

locations.description: First Archbishop of Serbia, patron saint of Serbia

summary: Sava was a Serbian prince who became a monk and the first Archbishop of the Serbian Orthodox Church. He was the son of Stefan Nemanja, the founder of the NemanjiÄ‡ dynasty. He established the independence of the Serbian Church and is credited with organizing the Serbian Orthodox Church. He is the patron saint of Serbia, Serbs, and Serbian schools. His influence on Serbian culture and identity is profound.
